Description: Hold a dumbbell close to your chest with both hands and squat down, keeping your chest tall and core engaged.
Hold dumbbells at your sides or shoulders and perform a squat to build leg strength.
Hold dumbbells at shoulder height and squat, emphasizing core stability and upright posture.
Press dumbbells overhead from shoulder height, engaging core and keeping arms straight at the top.
Lie on a bench, press dumbbells upward from chest level until arms are extended, then lower under control.
With one hand braced, pull a dumbbell toward your torso, squeezing your shoulder blade back.
Hinge forward at the hips with both dumbbells hanging, then row them toward your torso.
Hold dumbbells at your thighs, hinge at the hips with a flat back, lowering weights down the legs before returning upright.
Hold dumbbells at your sides or in front, hinge at hips and bend knees to lift from the floor to standing.
Perform a squat holding dumbbells at shoulders, then drive up and press them overhead in one motion.
From a plank, lower your chest to the floor and press back up, keeping body straight.
Perform an explosive push-up, pushing off the ground to clap hands before landing softly.
After each push-up, tap one hand to the opposite shoulder, alternating sides.
Hang from a bar with palms facing away and pull your chin above the bar.
Perform a pull-up with assistance from a band or support to reduce resistance.
Jump or step to the top of a pull-up, then lower yourself slowly under control.
Hang from a pull-up bar to build grip and shoulder stability.
Step onto a box or bench with one leg, driving through the heel to stand tall before stepping down.
Lower hips back and down into a squat using only bodyweight, then stand back up.
Perform a bodyweight squat, then jump explosively and land softly.
Step into a lunge, then jump explosively to switch legs in the air, landing in the opposite lunge.
From standing, drop into a push-up, then jump up explosively with arms overhead.
Swing a kettlebell or dumbbell between your legs and explosively drive hips forward to swing it up to chest or overhead.
Run as fast as possible over a short distance.
Sprint back and forth between two points, stopping and changing direction quickly.
Row on an ergometer at maximum effort for short bursts.
Cycle on a stationary or road bike at varying intensities, from easy steady state to hard interval efforts.
Row on an ergometer or water rower at a steady pace or high-intensity intervals.
Perform sustained running or run–walk intervals, including distances from 1 mile up to 10–12 miles or trail runs.

Exercise: Ruck (light to heavy, various distances and loads)
Description: Walk or hike carrying a weighted backpack over distances from 2 to 20 miles.
Walk on trails or uneven terrain at a comfortable pace.
Gentle walk for recovery and circulation.
Easy running at a conversational pace.
Dynamic or static stretches and drills to improve joint range of motion and reduce stiffness.
Static or dynamic stretches to lengthen muscles and aid recovery.
Guided movement and postures focused on flexibility, balance, and relaxation.
Hold a straight-body position on your forearms or hands, keeping your core, glutes, and legs engaged to build trunk stability.
